title: Monthly dep hygiene sweep across all repos

brief.why: Unused deps accumulate silently — only caught when a CVE triggers Dependabot. Proactive monthly sweep catches dead weight before it matters.
brief.what: Todoist recurring task (monthly) to run github-cleanup Phase 4c across ~/Repos. Could also be a cron job that opens a PR.
brief.done: Recurring reminder exists and has fired at least once

title: Show stale indicator in search results

brief.why: Stale sources appear in search without indication that their path is invalid, causing confusion
brief.what: Add [stale] marker to search output for sources with status=stale
brief.done: Search results show [stale] indicator, optionally filter with --include-stale or --exclude-stale

title: Garde indexes Amp threads as a first-class source

brief.why: Amp is thread-focused — every conversation is a discrete, retrievable thread with an ID and URL. Unlike CC sessions (scattered JSONL in ~/.claude/projects/), Amp threads are structured and easy to enumerate. garde should parse them all, not just rely on close-ritual extractions.
brief.what: 1. Identify where Amp stores thread data on disk (or API) 2. Write an Amp adapter in src/garde/adapters/ that enumerates and parses threads 3. Extract content suitable for FTS indexing 4. Add --source amp to CLI choices 5. Test with real Amp threads
brief.done: uv run garde scan --source amp indexes Amp threads. uv run garde search finds content from Amp conversations. uv run garde recent --all shows Amp threads alongside CC sessions.

brief.why: Backfill is a catch-up operation that spawns subprocess per source. Extracting during /close uses tokens already being spent, has richer context, and eliminates the backfill queue entirely.
brief.what: 1. Add store-extraction call to /close skill after handoff write 2. Use HYBRID_EXTRACTION_PROMPT in-context (no subprocess needed) 3. Pipe result to mem store-extraction 4. Test with a real /close cycle
brief.done: New sessions get extractions at close time. Backfill queue stays empty without manual runs.

title: Audit repos without committed lock files

brief.why: Repos with pyproject.toml but no uv.lock in git mean Dependabot can't scan them — a blind spot in the security posture.
brief.what: Scan all spm1001 repos for presence of uv.lock/package-lock.json. Flag repos that have manifests but no lock file committed.
brief.done: List produced, lock files committed where appropriate

title: Automate runtime-engine detection in dep audit

brief.why: Current dep audit relies on prose advice to check for openpyxl/lxml/kaleido before removing. A script would be more robust and prevent accidental breakage.
brief.what: Script that greps source for string references like 'lxml', 'openpyxl', write_image, asyncio_mode before confirming a dep is truly unused. Integrate into github-cleanup Phase 4c.
brief.done: Script exists, tested against writing-style-and-criticism (lxml) and itv-linkedin-analytics (openpyxl, kaleido)
